name: Richie Kavanagh
description:
'''Richard Kavanagh''' (born 19 March 1949) is an Irish singer-songwriter.

Despite [[psoriasis]] crippling his hands, at the age of 44, he went on to become a singer-songwriter who wrote the song "Aon Focal Eile" which gained national attention in 1996. Tony Keogh in [[South East Radio]] was the first person to play the song and, after [[Gerry Ryan]] began playing it on his [[RTÃ‰ 2fm]] national morning show, Kavanagh had a top-ten hit.
